parameters.content:
## Parse the input command
- is it a valid operation
- derive the arguements and operation

values.prompt:
=Write exactly four concise points summarizing the following text.
The first line of your response must be: "ðŸ“„ Summary of {{$('Loop Over Items1').item.json.name}}:". Use thematic emoji befitting the point at the start of it.
Do not include any extra words before or after. 
Do not add introductions, conclusions, or explanations:


"{text}"


CONCISE SUMMARY:

parameters.content:
# Files Summarizer Group
- Get all the file IDs from SUMMARY code node.
- If there is any error such as there being multiple arguement fields, invalid syntax use exception node to handle
- Download them in batches and summarize over each
- The limit of twilio whatsapp messages are 1600 characters so fragment the summaries and send as different messages.

## Prefetch the folder IDs
- every operation ahead requires the file/folder IDs
- We query to get all the files/folders IDs.

## Error Response
- responds with appropriate error message

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet

parameters.content:
## Logging
- appends the time of operation, the whatsapp number of one who performed did the operation, and the operation
- stores only write operations

## LIST
- code node checks whether folder exists or not
- also check if the path is valid or not
- this operation valid only for folder
- simply sending command LIST will return top most drive items

## DELETE
- get the ID of corresponding folder or files to be deleted from Tree.
- DELETE exception handles error and mass deletion.
- The confirmation key is unique to the user created using their phone number.
- If there are multiple items to be deleted like in case of mass deletion we loop over items and delete in batches

## MOVE
- get the file id and destination folder id from Tree.
- Move exception handles errors.

## CREATE
- Get the folder ID of destination folder from Tree
- CREATE exception handles errors

## UPLOAD
- Get the destination folder ID from tree.
- gets the media url from webhook body
- download this data in get file request node.
- then upload this file using name given by user

parameters.name: Body
parameters.value:
=Operations:
ðŸ“‚ LIST path/to/folder  
ðŸ—‘ï¸ DELETE path/to/item 
ðŸ“¦ MOVE path/to/src path/to/dest  
ðŸ“ CREATE destination_path folder_name  
â¬†ï¸ UPLOAD destination_path file_name  
ðŸ“ SUMMARY path/to/item 

for better info, <operation_name> /help

parameters.content:
## Construct Tree
- We reconstruct a tree like structure for the given files and folder.
- This reduces the query time up ahead from O(n^2) to O(n) where n is the number of items.
## Output:
id string,
name string,
mimeType string,
children []

## First Switch
- There are operations that would not require expensive api calls
- These are the HELP and instances where user gives wrong operation

## HELP Response
- list the possible operations and their syntax.
